text: hi

manager in google cloud i'm here to talk
to you about k4 pipelines version 2.
before we get into what qfloor pipelines
is
let me start with what i mean by a
pipeline because the term pipeline can
be a bit overloaded
here we're talking about machine
learning pipelines
because machine learning models require
complex multi-step workflows when
building a model
for example you may have to clean and
transform data create features train
multiple models and evaluate those
models
managing and executing these workflows
can be difficult especially if you are
trying to run them in a reproducible
portable cost-effective and scalable way
when i say the term
pipeline i usually mean a way of
modeling one of these workflows as a set
of connected steps where each step takes
as input the upwards of a previous step
perform some additional computation and
produces outputs that can then be
utilized by future steps
what i have on the screen here is kind
of a canonical machine learning pipeline
one that you might
see in many many applications it
extracts data validates it prepares the
data and the data goes into a training
step
once the model has been trained the
model's been evaluated validated
deployed
q4 pipeline is an open source kubernetes
native framework for building and
deploying scalable repeatable machine
learning workflows
it allows you to model
ml workflows and series of container
executions where each container can take
input from a previous execution and
produce
outputs that can be used in subsequent
steps
if you can offset your pipelines using
either the qcl pipeline's sdk or the
tensorflow extended sdk
these sdks make it straight forward to
convert the python code you would
normally alter for turning a model into
a reproducible pipeline
they also make it easy for you to
orchestrate
non-python code because in q4 pipelines
every step of the pipeline is simply a
container execution
in addition to containers you can also
use kfp to orchestrate other
applications and services
currently a number of major clouds
including gcp
provide components that needed to
leverage their managed services with the
new machine learning pipelines for
example google cloud provides components
that allow you to take advantage of
gcp's data flow or vertex ai
ai's distributed training service
q4 pipeline takes care of the work
associated with scheduling each step the
passing information between steps and
captures metadata about the artifacts
produced and consumed for each step in
the pipeline just to name a few of the
capabilities of the system
when we look at
the next version of kubeflow for
pipeline v2
we
have really spread our effort across
four key areas
the overall goal is to of course make
the system easy to use and make it much
simpler for the community builds on top
of kfb
the first major area of improvement is
metadata metrics
right now qfl pipeline automatically
tracks the artifacts that are producing
complaints by each step in the pipeline
in v2 we're going to add the ability for
specify their custom metadata for
artifacts enabling users to provide rich

we will provide simpler richer ways to

along with the robust set of

but also streamlining the keyframe

use
removing their denim functionality and

adding modern styling and making

finally and perhaps most importantly we

independent representation of mml

floor platforms

in terms of metadata metrics we're
making these first classes in the
of the platform
we'll now provide a standardized type
ontology
tool for querying and updating metadata

the ability to query and visualize

for example

the ui is also getting the refresh the

it will also

finally let me talk a little bit about

we
have had a number of requests over the

the goal here is to make it easy for
